trustfund: TF026215-FINANCING OF AUSAID SECONDMENTS,TF035426-INDIA - HEALTH PROJECTS

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Maharashtra Health
            Systems Development Project for India was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, and the Bank and borrower
            performance were both satisfactory. Following are some of
            the lessons learned from the project: External funding is
            inevitably used as a substitute for government funding,
            despite assurances provided to the contrary. Project
            management arrangements need to coordinate with Directorate
            of Health Services operations as early as possible. User
            fees do contribute vital resources towards non-salary
            recurrent costs that can make a substantial difference to
            the quality of care at hospitals.
